title: Ordered HTML List
text: An ordered list starts with the <ol> tag. Each list item starts with the <li> tag.
The list items will be marked with numbers by default:

title: Ordered HTML List - The Type Attribute
text:
The type attribute of the <ol> tag, defines the type of the 
list item marker:

Uppercase Letters:
     
  1. Coffee
    2.  
  2. Tea
    3.  
  3. Milk
Try it Yourself »

Lowercase Letters:
     
  1. Coffee
    2.  
  2. Tea
    3.  
  3. Milk
Try it Yourself »

Uppercase Roman Numbers:
     
  1. Coffee
    2.  
  2. Tea
    3.  
  3. Milk
Try it Yourself »

Lowercase Roman Numbers:
     
  1. Coffee
    2.  
  2. Tea
    3.  
  3. Milk
Try it Yourself »

title: Control List Counting
text: By default, an ordered list will start counting from 1. If you want to start counting from a specified number, you can use the start attribute:

title: Nested HTML Lists
text: Lists can be nested (list inside list):

Example
     
  1. Coffee
    2.  
  2. Tea    
           
    1. Black tea
      2.      
    2. Green tea
      3.    
     
    3.  
  3. Milk
Try it Yourself »

Note: A list item (<li>) can contain 
  a new list, and other HTML elements, like images and links, etc.
